title: Adobe Illustrator gradient question...
content:
Sorry for such a small image but does anyone know how I do a gradient in illustrator like this? I can only do one that is either linear or radial.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018105353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grad_6232.jpg)
author: Biff

comments.content: There isn't an easy way to do this gradient in illustrator, but it's possible. You'll have to use the gradient mesh tool and create several small gradients that track around a circle.
Thanks, is there another program that is better for this?
Or depending on the use you could just do it nice and large in Photoshop and place it. A gradient mesh will rasterize in a rip anyway.

Create two rectangles (one black one white). Create a blend between the two. Set the blend to smooth color and to align to path. Create an art brush out of the blend. apply the brush to a circle. Increase the stroke weight until a point is created at the center.  
Let me know if any of this doesn't make sense. I was able to recreate your example perfectly.

Josh

Thanks Josh, that sounds good. I'll let you know if i can't do it.
